intro: Chimarrhis longistipulata, commonly known as the long-stippled acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves with long, slender stipules. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typically borne on slender, branching stalks. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes for its attractive foliage and floral display.
